poem:
Tylenol and the Common Tongue  

In the paper's shadow,  
claims flicker—  
unraveled threads  
of rhyme and reason.  
Pregnant silence,  
the swell of doubt,  
a nation caught  
in the absurd grasp  
of conjecture,  
while truth  
waits to be sung  
in voices  
clear as a morning  
unweighted by fog.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump’s absurd Tylenol claims heighten the suffering of pregnant women in the US | Moira Donegan Robert F Kennedy Jr continued his futile search for a single pharmaceutical cause of autism on Monday, when the Trump administration claimed that distorted recent studies and misstated scientific evidence to allege a link between women’s Tylenol use during pregnancy and the development of autism in children. Kennedy has long spoken with disturbing disgust about autistic people, claiming at". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
